name.text: PT.1.12 (Line tangent to parabola, from graph)

questiontext.text:
(a) Find the equation of the parabola shown in the diagram.

[[jsxgraph width='200px' height='200px']] JXG.Options.axis.ticks.majorHeight = 60; JXG.Options.axis.ticks.insertTicks = false; JXG.Options.axis.ticks.ticksDistance = 50; JXG.Options.text.fontSize = 16; var board = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard(divid, {boundingbox: {#BB#}, axis: true, showCopyright: false, showNavigation:false}); var f = board.jc.snippet('{#quad#}', true, 'x', true); board.create('functiongraph', [f,-10,10],{strokeColor:'#003399',strokeWidth:2}); var xaxis = board.create('axis', [[0,0],[1,0]]); board.create('ticks', [xaxis, [{#A[1]#},{#B[1]#}]], {strokeColor: '#003399', majorHeight:15, drawLabels: true, label: { offset: [0, -10],anchorX: 'middle', anchorY: 'top' }}); var c = board.create('point',{#C#}, {name:'({#C[1]#},{#C[2]#})',size:2,fixed:true,strokeColor:'#003399',fillColor:'#003399',label:{anchorX:'right',anchorY:'top',offset: [0, -5]}}); [[/jsxgraph]]

(b) The line with equation \(y= {@l@}\) is tangent to the parabola. Find the value of \(k.\)

      \(k=\) [[input:ans2]][[feedback:prt2]] [[validation:ans2]]

generalfeedback.text:
(a) The parabola has roots when \(x={@A[1]@}\) and \(x={@B[1]@}\) so its equation will be of the form \(y={@c*(x-A[1])*(x-B[1])@}\).

Since the parabola passes through \(({@C[1]@},{@C[2]@})\) we have \( {@C[2]@}={@c*ev((x-A[1])*(x-B[1]),x=C[1])@} \) thus \(c={@(C[2])/((C[1]-A[1])*(C[1]-B[1]))@}\).

So the parabola has equation \(y={@ta1@}\).

(b) The line \(y= {@l@}\) is tangent to the parabola \( y = {@quad@} \) when these two intersect at one point. 

So we solve \[ \begin{align*} {@quad@} &= {@l@} \\ {@quad-l@} &= 0 \end{align*}\]

To intersect at one point means that the discriminant of this quadratic equation should be \(0\).

We have \(a={@da@}\), \(b={@db@}\) and \(c={@dc@}\), so

\[ \begin{align*} b^2-4ac = ({@db@})^2 - 4({@da@})({@dc@}) &= 0  \\ {@expand((db)^2-4*da*dc)@} &= 0  \\ k &= {@ta2@}\end{align*} \]
